title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020), after consultation with the
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic Act 1994 (Detention
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic Act 1994 (Detention 

of Vehicles) (Amendment) Regulations 2021.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited road traffic act 1994 (detention vehicles) (amendment) regulation 2021

title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020), after consultation with the
heading: In these Regulations “Principal Regulations” means the Road Traffic Act
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations “Principal Regulations” means the Road Traffic Act 

1994 (Detention of Vehicles) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 460 of 2011).
text_norm: 2 regulation principal regulation mean road traffic act 1994 (detention vehicles) regulation 2011 (s.i no 460 2011)

title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020), after consultation with the
heading: 3. Regulation 2 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the insertion of
text_raw:
3. Regulation 2 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the insertion of 

the following definitions: 

“‘certificate of roadworthiness’ has the same meaning as it has in the Road 
Safety Authority (Commercial Vehicle Roadworthiness) Act 2012 (No. 16 of 
2012); 

‘test certificate’ has the same meaning as it has in the Road Traffic Act 1961 
(No. 24 of 1961).”.
text_norm: 3 regulation 2 principal regulation amended insertion following definition certificate roadworthiness meaning road safety authority (commercial vehicle roadworthiness) act 2012 (no 16 2012) test certificate meaning road traffic act 1961 (no 24 1961)

title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020), after consultation with the
heading: 4. Regulation 6 of the Principal Regulations is amended –
text_raw:
4. Regulation 6 of the Principal Regulations is amended – 

(a) by the substitution of the following paragraph for paragraph (d): 

“(d) in the case of a vehicle referred to in section 41(1)(d) of the 
Act of 1994, that at the time it was detained a test certificate 
was in force in respect of the vehicle, or”, and 

(b) by the substitution of the following paragraph for paragraph (e): 

“(e) 

in the case of a vehicle referred to in section 41(1)(e) of the 
Act of 1994, that at the time it was detained a certificate of 
roadworthiness was in force in respect of the vehicle,”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 20th April, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [179] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

15 April, 2021. 

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for Transport. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [179]

title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020), after consultation with the
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These regulations amend the Road Traffic Act 1994 (Detention of Vehicles) 
Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 460 of 2011) to provide that the relevant waiver of 
charges provisions in the Regulations apply to all test certificates and certificates 
of roadworthiness issued by Member States and not only to those issued by Irish 
authorities. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [179] 5
